intro: Dinochloa karaboensis, commonly known as the Karabo grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, spikelet-like inflorescences with tiny flowers. Due to its ecological importance and unique adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
